docs.snippet: Portugal midfielder Raul Meireles will not face punishment for raising his fingers in a gesture during his team's 4-0 World Cup thrashing by Germany on Monday, FIFA said on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Portugal midfielder Raul Meireles will not face punishment for raising his fingers in a gesture during his team's 4-0 World Cup thrashing by Germany on Monday, FIFA said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Portugal's Meireles in the Clear Over Raised Fingers

docs.snippet: The NCAA began making its case for keeping the current model for college sports, with the women's athletic director at the University of Texas testifying Tuesday that paying basketball and football players would tear apart the very foundation the ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The NCAA began making its case for keeping the current model for college sports, with the women's athletic director at the University of Texas testifying Tuesday that paying basketball and football players would tear apart the very foundation the school's athletics are based upon.

headline.main: NCAA Begins Making Its Case for Amateurism
headline.print_headline: NCAA Begins Making Its Case for Amateurism

docs.snippet: HONOROFF--Richard A.,on June 13, 2014 after a long illness. Born in Chicago, May 24, 1951. A composer, arranger, musician and musical director, he worked in television, musical theater, jazz and classical venues. He wrote music for television spor...
docs.lead_paragraph: HONOROFF--Richard A.,on June 13, 2014 after a long illness. Born in Chicago, May 24, 1951. A composer, arranger, musician and musical director, he worked in television, musical theater, jazz and classical venues. He wrote music for television sports including theme music for the National Football League, Atlanta Hawks basketball and for the 1988 and 1992 Olympic Games coverage. He performed as pianist on Broadway for the show, Eubie, and performed with many jazz greats. Off-Broadway he was musical director for five shows, including The Cotton Club Revisited. He wrote three orchestral works. Symphony No. 1 "Shoah" and a companion piece "Testament" were composed for and performed at The Shoah Concert in Berlin on February 4, 1994. Symphony No. 2, "From Ashes Reborn" was in part inspired by the protest of a Viet Nam War veteran. All three works were recorded in 1994 and 1995 by the Moscow Radio and Television Orchestra, led by Alexander Mikhailov. He is survived by his son, Zachary, and daughter, Julia, as well as his brother and sister-in-law, Brad and Jane Honoroff. A private memorial service will be held in July.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  HONOROFF, RICHARD A.

docs.snippet: Miami-Dade County lawmakers agreed on Tuesday to commit tax revenues to the Miami Dolphins football team if it can attract big-ticket events like the NFL's Super Bowl and World Cup soccer matches to its privately owned stadium....
docs.lead_paragraph: Miami-Dade County lawmakers agreed on Tuesday to commit tax revenues to the Miami Dolphins football team if it can attract big-ticket events like the NFL's Super Bowl and World Cup soccer matches to its privately owned stadium.

headline.main: County Lawmakers Approve Compromise Deal Over Miami Dolphins Stadium
headline.print_headline: County Lawmakers Approve Compromise Deal Over Miami Dolphins Stadium
